Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2009 12:11PM kaitig wrote: This is my first post, but just wanted to say back in 1994 I was diagnosed 2 1/2 months after I had my second child, first found it at 6 weeks and Dr. thought it was a blocked duct... so by the time I was finally diagnosed with a grade 3 ER-PR- (before HER-2 testing) nasty cancer it was stage III.  I hit it hard with surgery/chemo/radiation... and it's now 2009, and my baby is a freshman in high school.  Have faith that this may all be okay....  I am back here finishing treatment on a second primary - no relation to first (don't you just love BC), but after the first go around, I know that we can get through this.  Best wishes for all those fighting this, especially when the kids are so young.  You will surprise yourself with how tough you are.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed 3 months after giving birth to my second child kelty kelty

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2009 05:48PM kaitig wrote: You have alot to digest... I'm sorry for the unwelcome news but at least you know what your are up against (and it's out of your body).  My prognosis back in 1994 was over 75% recurrence, extremely high risk... and medical science "Beat" that one.  Your case is an individual one, always remember you are not a statistic.  Make sure you feel comfortable with your doctors, you want someone who will fight with you.  YOU CAN DO THIS.... one step at a time.  I'm glad the surgery is over, and the tumor burden is so much less.  Try to get some rest.. the rollercoaster continues... up and down... just remember that it will go up again.  I am sorry you have to go through the down sides.  Feel free to PM me if you'd like.
Posts.Title: Path report need suppor- Prognosis stats mentioned in post thisisme nelia48

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2009 08:41PM kaitig wrote: Thisisme:  I did the same thing as you... making a list of all the things I had to be there for the the kids in the future.  Actually wrote it down with my husband in the oncologist's office waiting room.  Fight this beast... have faith that things will be fine after the treatment... and you can marvel at your list with all the check-offs on it as the years pass.  {hugs}
